item.title: The Crow and the Pitcher
item.description: A CROW, half-dead with thirst, came upon a Pitcher which had once been full of water; but when the Crow put its beak into the mouth of the Pitcher he found that only very little water was left in it, and that he could not reach far enough down to get at it.

item.title: The Dog in the Manger
item.description: A dog looking out for its afternoon nap jumped into the manger of an ox and lay there cosily upon the straw.

item.title: The Fox Without a Tail
item.description: It happened that a FOX caught its tail in a trap, and in struggling to release himself lost all of it but the stump.

item.title: The Fox and the Grapes
item.description: FOX, very hungry, chanced to come into a vineyard, where hung branches of charming ripe grapes, but nailed up to trellis so high, that he leaped till he quite tired himself without being able to reach one of them.

item.title: The Ant and the Grasshopper
item.description: In a field one summer’s day, a Grasshopper was hopping about, chirping and singing to its heart’s content.

item.title: The Lions Share
item.description: THE Lion went once a-hunting along with the Fox, the Jackal, and the Wolf.

item.title: The Lion and the Mouse
item.description: ONCE when a Lion was asleep a little Mouse began running up and down upon him; this soon wakened the Lion, who placed his huge paw upon him, and opened his big jaws to swallow him.

item.title: The Shepherds Boy
item.description: There was once a young Shepherd Boy who tended his sheep at the foot of a mountain near a dark forest.

item.title: The Woodsman and the Serpent
item.description: One wintry day a Woodman was tramping home from his work when he saw something black lying on the snow.

item.title: The Frogs Desiring a King
item.description: THE Frogs were living as happy as could be in a marshy swamp that just suited them; they went splashing about caring for nobody and nobody troubling with them.

item.title: The Fox and the Crow
item.description: A Fox once saw a Crow fly off with a piece of cheese in its beak and settle on a branch of a tree.

item.title: The Milkmaid and Her Pail
item.description: Patty, the Milkmaid, was going to market carrying her milk in a Pail on her head.
